_metadata.description: Basin-specific petrophysical parameters for wireline data analysis
sources: Regional basin studies and core calibration databases
notes: All Archie parameters are averages for basin - local calibration recommended
Formation water resistivity varies with depth/temperature - use gradient if available
Shale parameters based on regional core studies
Lithology densities are matrix values (zero porosity)

basins.name: Gulf Coast Tertiary
basins.description: Unconsolidated to poorly consolidated sandstones and shales. High porosity, low cementation.

archie_parameters.description: Humble formula (a=0.62, m=2.15) - industry standard for Gulf Coast unconsolidated sands

basins.name: Permian Basin
basins.description: Carbonate and mixed clastic-carbonate sequences. Highly variable porosity from tight to vuggy.

archie_parameters.description: Standard Archie for consolidated carbonates. Use m=1.8-2.2 for vuggy zones.

basins.saturation_model_recommendation: Archie for clean carbonates. Dual Water for Wolfcamp shales.

basins.name: North Sea Brent
basins.description: Marine and deltaic sandstones. Well-sorted, high quality reservoir sands.

archie_parameters.description: Clean, well-sorted marine sands with low cementation exponent

basins.saturation_model_recommendation: Archie (clean sands). Simandoux for shaley intervals.

basins.name: Middle East Carbonate
basins.description: Platform carbonates with extensive diagenesis. Fractures and vugs common.

archie_parameters.description: Standard carbonate Archie. Reduce m to 1.7-1.8 for vuggy/fractured zones.

basins.saturation_model_recommendation: Archie for matrix porosity. Special models for fractures.

basins.name: Bakken Shale
basins.description: Organic-rich shale with tight sandstone and dolostone members. Unconventional resource play.

archie_parameters.description: High tortuosity (a) and cementation (m) for tight rock. Often use dual porosity models.

formation_water.gradient_comment: Extremely high salinity - often saturated brine

shale.description: Type II kerogen, TOC 5-15%, high maturity

basins.saturation_model_recommendation: Dual Water or Modified Simandoux (high organic content affects resistivity)

basins.name: Malay Basin
basins.description: Deepwater turbidite sands with high shale content. Gas-prone with significant dispersed shale.

archie_parameters.description: Modified Humble formula for turbidite sands

formation_water.gradient_comment: Moderate salinity - partially marine, partially meteoric influence

basins.saturation_model_recommendation: Indonesia (dispersed shale is typical). Dual Water for very shaley pay.

basins.name: Marcellus Shale
basins.description: Organic-rich marine shale. Major unconventional gas play in Appalachian Basin.

archie_parameters.description: Very high tortuosity and cementation for mature shale. Complex pore network.

formation_water.gradient_comment: Hypersaline brines - among highest salinity globally

shale.description: Type II kerogen, TOC 3-12%, thermally mature

basins.saturation_model_recommendation: Specialized shale models (Passey, Jarvie-Bowker). Standard models unreliable.
basins.vsh_calculation: Not applicable - formation is shale. Use TOC and mineralogy instead.

basins.name: West Texas Delaware
basins.description: Mixed carbonate-siliciclastic deepwater basin deposits. Part of greater Permian Basin.

formation_water.gradient_comment: Very high salinity similar to greater Permian Basin

basins.saturation_model_recommendation: Simandoux or Indonesia depending on shale distribution. Consider organic matter effects.

basins.name: North Sea Chalk
basins.description: Highly porous, low permeability chalk reservoirs. Fractures critical for production.

archie_parameters.description: Higher m reflects tortuous micropore system in chalk

chalk.description: Biogenic calcite (coccoliths). Dual porosity: matrix + fractures

basins.saturation_model_recommendation: Modified Archie for matrix. Dual porosity models for fractured zones.

basins.name: Generic Clean Sandstone
basins.description: Default parameters for clean, consolidated quartz sandstones. Use as starting point for calibration.

archie_parameters.description: Classic Archie (1942) parameters. Universal starting point.

formation_water.gradient_comment: Typical formation water values. Always calibrate to local conditions.

basins.saturation_model_recommendation: Archie for Vsh < 0.10. Simandoux/Indonesia for higher Vsh.
basins.vsh_calculation: Use appropriate non-linear correction based on formation age
